messages.message:
Hello, i've been following this doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yQOCxOISV_ukUxXdPJDoN-rERtOhdVRe7zv1swF1igw/edit#heading=h.3aevre3cxfr5) to try to bring up instabase locally. I ran
```python3 provisioner.py compile lite && python provisioner.py start lite && python provisioner.py status lite```
and it seems to have gotten stuck here. is there a known fix for this? (apologies if this is the wrong channel for this)
```Compiling Instabase apps...
(node:32085) DeprecationWarning: Tapable.plugin is deprecated. Use new API on `.hooks` instead
Browserslist: caniuse-lite is outdated. Please run:
npx browserslist@latest --update-db

Why you should do it regularly:
https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist#browsers-data-updating```
How long have you been at that message? I was doing this yesterday and it took quite a while to get through that part.

@Vishnu seems like it is stuck on compiling `server-nginx`
Can you take a look at this thread with a similar issue: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C039JKRCE2H/p1653373899136769
Looks like the tldr is `changing to nvm v12.18.3 works!`
I see, `nvm use 12.18.3` is the correct command for this?
Also need to install nvm and use the work around for M1 chip as described here: https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm#macos-troubleshooting (if you are using M1)
